title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {DANA: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data},   author = {Yannick Düren and Johannes Lederer and Li-Xuan Qin},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.3.1}, }

what: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
title: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
text: DANA approach assessing performance normalization microRNA-Seq data based biology-motivated data-driven metrics. approach takes advantage well-known biological features microRNAs expression pattern polycistronic clustering assess (1) effectively normalization removes handling effects (2) normalization biases true biological signals. DANA implemented R can used assessing normalization method (minimal assumptions) microRNA-Seq data set requires additional information polycistronic clustering marker location genome, typically readily available. general, can apply DANA assessment normalization method long normalized counts non-negative. simplicity, provide eight commonly used normalization methods: Total Count (TC) Upper Quartile (UQ) Median (median) Trimmed Median Means (TMM) DESeq Quantile Normalization (QN) Remove Unwanted Variation (subtypes: RUVg, RUVr, RUVs) PoissonSeq normalization method study, DANA computes two assessment metrics: cc mscr: cc measures preservation biological signals versus normalization. high value indicates high preservation biological signals (cc <= 1). mscr measures relative reduction handling versus normalization. high mscr indicates higher removal handling effects. optimal normalization maximally removes handling effects (high mscr) keeping biological signals intact (cc close 1). However, cases, clear “best” method maximal mscr maximal cc. Therefore, one aim best possible trade-proposed statistics negative positive controls emphasis keeping biological signals intact (cc close 1). two metrics can easily assessed plotting metrics scatter plot (see function plotDANA) normalization method study, preferable method located towards top-right quadrant plot.

title: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
text: can install released version DANA directly GitHub using devtools : R package PoissonSeq PoissonSeq normalization removed CRAN, can install archived version github using:

title: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
text: Please refer documentation page detailed function references. Generally, users need provide raw count matrix RNA-Seq studies (without normalization transformation) information polycistronic clustering miRNAs. Clustering information can readily computed using defineClusters function miRNA chromosome location information (base-pair/nucleotide location) available. data using notation miRBase (v22), data TCGA, DANA includes necessary information. data using notation, user must provide chromosome nucleotide location chromosome miRNA data inputs chr pos, respectively, defineClusters function. Assume raw.counts hold raw un-normalized count data row names correspond genes column names correspond sample names. groups vector sample groups (e.g. sample sub-types). First, normalize raw count data using provided normalization routine: Next, define polycistronic clusters miRNAs. miRNA data using miRBase (v22) notation, chr pos provide information chromosome location marker chromosome raw.counts. Define positive negative control markers using defineControls function. Positive control markers well-expressed ([tWell, inf)), clustered markers representing biological effects. Negative control markers poorly-expressed ([tZero, tPoor]) primarily represent handling effects. Adjust bounds positive negative controls data set, e.g. using helper plot functions plotMeanSD plotCountHist. Use DANA assess normalization data set: Finally, assess normalization stated use plotDANA function compare result metrics cc mscr normalization method.
code: normalized <- applyNormalization(   raw.counts,   groups,   method = c("TC", "UQ", "median", "TMM", "DESeq", "PoissonSeq", "QN", "RUV")) # miRBase (v22) notation clusters <- defineClusters(rownames(raw.counts))  # other notation -> provide "chr" and "pos" clusters <- defineClusters(rownames(raw.counts), chr, pos) controls <- defineControls(   raw.counts,    tZero = 2,     # lower count bound for negative controls   tPoor = 5,     # upper count bound for negative controls   tWell = 100,   # lower count bound for positive controls   clusters) res <- assessNormalization(   raw=raw.counts,   normalized  = normalized,   negControls = controls$negControls,   posControls = controls$posControls,   clusters    = clusters) plotDANA(res)

what: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
text: Applies single multiple normalization methods given data.   Available methods : Total Count (TC) Upper Quartile (UQ) Median (median) Trimmed Median Means (TMM) DESeq PoissonSeq Quantile Normalization (QN) Remove Unwanted Variation (RUVg, RUVr, RUVs)

title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
code: applyNormalization(   data,   groups = rep(0, ncol(data)),   method = c("TC", "UQ", "median", "TMM", "DESeq", "PoissonSeq", "QN", "RUV") )

title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
text: data Un-normalized count data set shape p x n, p number markers n number samples. groups Vector length n maps samples sample groups. method Vector normalization methods applied data. Available methods : c("TC", "UQ", "median", "TMM", "DESeq", "PoissonSeq", "QN", "RUV"). Select one multiple methods. default normalization methods applied.

title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
text: List normalized read counts selected normalization methods.

title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
text: different groups conditions present data, groups vector must provide group label sample , thus, maps sample sample group (condition). "RUV" normalization applied data, groups must provided; otherwise, providing sample groups optional.

what: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
title: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
text: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment

title: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
text: raw Raw read count matrix (rows = genes, cols = samples). rows columns count matrix must named, rownames(raw) marker names colnames(raw) sample names. normalized Named list normalized count matrices. matrix holds normalized read count matrix corresponding normalization method study. list member must named (e.g. used normalization). matrix normalized must named row names marker names column names sample names. list normalized counts can generated using applyNormalization function. negControls Vector negative control markers generated function defineControls. posControls Vector positive control markers generated function defineControls. clusters Named Vector clusters. Associates miRNA raw polycistronic cluster. Usually generated using function defineClusters.

title: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
text: DANA Assessment metrics provided normalized counts (  normalized count matrix).   DANA computes two assessment metrics: cc cc measures preservation biological signals   versus normalization.   high value indicates high preservation biological signals   (cc <= 1).   particular, cc concordance correlation coefficient   within-cluster partial correlation among positive controls   normalization. mscr mscr measures relative reduction handling   versus normalization. high mscr indicates higher   removal handling effects.   particular, mscr mean-squared correlation reduction   negative controls normalization. selecting normalization method raw data, one aim best possible trade-hight cc high mscr.

title: Compute the mean correlation reduction in negative controls — compute.mscr
Polycistronic clustering of miRNAs — defineClusters
text: Defines polycistronic clusters given set miRNAs based chromosomal location. microRNAs human genome (homo sapiens) using mirBAse v22 notation, chromosomal coordinates provided. can used e.g. data TCGA. use miRNA annotation different miRBase v22, must provide chromosomal location including chromosome ('chr') nucleotide position chromosome ('pos').

title: Polycistronic clustering of miRNAs — defineClusters
text: genes List genes miRNA clustering computed. chr Optional. Vector specifies chromosome miRNA genes. given, miRBase v22 chromosomal coordinates used. pos Optional. Vector nucleotice (base-pair) position miRNA genes chromosome, specified chr. position e.g. start, end averaged ((start+end)/2) base-pair position associated chromosome. given, miRBase v22 chromosomal coordinates used. threshold Maximum distance threshold base-pairs difintion polycistronic clusters. Default 10,000, corresponds miRBase's cluster definition.

title: Polycistronic clustering of miRNAs — defineClusters
text: Vector clusters. Associates miRNA genes   polycistronic cluster.

title: Definition of negative and positive control miRNAs for DANA normalization assessment — defineControls
Definition of negative and positive control miRNAs for DANA normalization assessment — defineControls
text: raw Raw read count matrix (rows = genes, cols = samples). matrix rows columns must named, rownames=miRNAs colnames=samples. tZero Lower (read count) bound definition negative controls. tPoor Upper (read count) bound definition negative controls. tWell Lower (read count) bound definition positive controls. clusters Named Vector clusters. Associates miRNA raw polycistronic cluster. Usually generated using function defineClusters.

title: Definition of negative and positive control miRNAs for DANA normalization assessment — defineControls
text: List two vectors: posControls Vector positive control markers (miRNAs) raw. negControls Vector negative control markers (miRNAs) raw.

what: Chromosomal coordinate for miRNA (hsa) from MiRBase v22 — miRNA.coordinates
title: Chromosomal coordinate for miRNA (hsa) from MiRBase v22 — miRNA.coordinates
text: Chromosomal coordinates Homo sapiens microRNAs. Note lower-case notation used miRNA names. microRNAs: miRBase v22 genome-build-id: GRCh38 genome-build-accession: NCBI_Assembly:GCA_000001405.15 Hairpin precursor sequences type "miRNA_primary_transcript". Note, sequences represent full primary transcript, rather predicted stem-loop portion includes precursor miRNA. Mature sequences type "miRNA".

title: Chromosomal coordinate for miRNA (hsa) from MiRBase v22 — miRNA.coordinates
Chromosomal coordinate for miRNA (hsa) from MiRBase v22 — miRNA.coordinates
text: 'miRNA.coordinates' data frame 3,619 rows 7 columns: name miRNA name lower-case     (e.g. "hsa-let-7b", "hsa-mir-100", ...) chromosome chromosome gene located . position Nucleotide coordinate chromosome. type Either "miRNA_primary_transcript" heirpin precursor     sequences "miRNA" mature sequences. start.position, end.position Starting ending nucleotide     coordinate chromosome. id Corresponding id (e.g. "MI0000063", "MI0000102")

title: Partial correlation estimation — partialCor
text: Partial correlation estimation using  neighborhood selection method (see Meinshausen, Buehlmann (2006)) estimation inverse covariance matrix (precision matrix)

what: Correlation plot for partial correlations within polycistronic clusters — plotCor
title: Correlation plot for partial correlations within polycistronic clusters — plotCor
text: function generates correlation (heatmap-type) plot partial correlations. Polycistronic clusters markers highlighted lower tri-diagonal part matrix partial correlations shown upper tri-diagonal part. Partial correlations can computed using partialCor function.

title: Correlation plot for partial correlations within polycistronic clusters — plotCor
Correlation plot for partial correlations within polycistronic clusters — plotCor
text: pCor Matrix partial correlations. Rows columns must named corresponding markers clusters Named Vector clusters. Associates marker polycistronic cluster. Usually generated using function defineClusters. title Optional. Plot title

title: Correlation plot for partial correlations within polycistronic clusters — plotCor
text: ggplot2 object correlation plot given partial correlations.

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
text: Plots histogram marker-specific mean log2-transformed read counts. Bounds definition positive negative controls can highlighted vertical lines (given).

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
code: plotCountHist(raw, binwidth = 0.1, tZero, tPoor, tWell, title)

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
text: raw Raw read count matrix (rows = genes, cols = samples). binwidth Optional. width bins numeric value. Default 0.1. tZero Optional. Lower bound negative controls. tPoor Optional. Upper bound negative controls. tWell Optional. Lower bound positive controls. title Plot title xlim.max Upper limit x-axis ylim.max Upper limit y-axis

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
text: ggplot2 object read count histogram

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
code: counts <- matrix(rnbinom(1000, mu=3, size=0.01), nrow=50) plotCountHist(counts)

what: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
text: Plot function scatter plot DANA result metrics generated using DANA normalization assessment assessNormalization. DANA Assessment metrics given normalized counts (normalized count matrix) provided data.frame columns: cc cc measures preservation biological signals   versus normalization.   high value indicates high preservation biological signals   (cc <= 1) mscr mscr measures relative reduction handling   versus normalization. high mscr indicates higher   removal handling effects. selecting normalization method raw data, one aim best possible trade-hight cc high mscr. function generates ggplot scatter plot DANA metrics selection suitable normalization method.

title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
code: plotDANA(   metrics,   label.size = 3,   label.repel = TRUE,   limits.x,   limits.y,   title )

title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
text: metrics data.frame DANA metrics containing metrics cc mscr columns. row represents normalization method. label.size Optional. Text size plot labels. label.repel Optional. Logical ggrepel package used space point labels. Requires package ggrepel installed. limits.x Optional. Must either missing, NA, c(x1,x2). given, x-axis limits set [0,1]. NA, x-axis limits automatically scaled data. c(x1,x2), x-axis limits scaled interval [x1,x2]. limits.y Optional. Must either missing, NA, c(y1,y2). given, y-axis limits set [0,1]. NA, y-axis limits automatically scaled data. c(y1,y2), y-axis limits scaled interval [y1,y2]. title Optional. Plot title

title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
text: ggplot2 object scatter plot given DANA metrics.

title: Mean-Standard Deviation Plot — plotMeanSD
text: raw Raw read count matrix (rows = genes, cols = samples). tZero Optional. Lower bound negative controls. tPoor Optional. Upper bound negative controls. tWell Optional. Lower bound positive controls. title Plot title xlim.max Upper limit x-axis ylim.max Upper limit y-axis

title: Mean-Standard Deviation Plot — plotMeanSD
text: ggplot2 object mean-sd plot

title: Mean-Standard Deviation Plot — plotMeanSD
code: counts <- matrix(rnbinom(1000, mu=3, size=0.01), nrow=50) plotMeanSD(counts)
